Title: Incident management implementation using continual service improvement method at PT AOP
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 International Conference on Applied Computer and Communication Technologies, ComCom 2017
Affiliations: Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ilvarianto, D.S., Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Legowo, N., Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: In the practice of managing IT services which refers to ITIL v3 framework, service providers are required to have a certain set of criteria and standards for Incident Management in order to deliver high quality service to end-users. The incident management process in PT. Astra Otoparts Tbk. (AOP) has a number of problems to be resolved, including the ticket reporting record system that is still considered conventional. The purpose of this study is to analyze the cause and effect of the identified problems in the implementation of electronic ticketing system to result in a more flexible ticket reporting process. By using Continual Service Improvement methods, this study utilized Process Maturity Framework to assess the maturity level of the running process. To get a more measurable result, this study also used Quality Control tools such as the Pareto Chart and Fishbone Diagram. The indications and gap found in this study will be resourced for further research to improve the system. The result of this study is a more effective ticket recording system. The study sees a 28.22 increase in the average number of tickets per month in the area of Cibitung and Cikarang. A recommendation process in the form of a new ticketing system will be submitted for the new policy. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Continual service improvement; Incident management; ITIL v3; Process maturity framework.; Ticketing
Index Keywords: Computer science; Computers; Incident Management; ITIL V3; Process maturity; Service improvement; Ticketing; Ticket issuing machines
